title: What are the facts and fallacies in Rachel Carson's 'Silent Spring'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Though Silent Spring does express an opinion against the use of pesticides, Carson uses lots of scientific research and evidence to back her claims. While it may be possible to argue that pesticides were not the primary factor, the majority of evidence strongly correlates DDT use with dramatic drops in avian fertility rates.

Since Silent Spring DDT has been replaced by other pesticides of questionable impact on the environment. Its interesting that studies not supported by Monsanto find troubling environmental consequences for glyphosate. Ecotoxicology of Glyphosate and Glyphosate-Based Herbicides - Toxicity to Wildlife and Humans But studies supported by Monsanto find none http://www.cdpr.ca.gov/docs/emon/pubs/fatememo/glyphos.pdf
